questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory domain. The domain contains 10 computers that run Windows 10. Users in the finance department use the computers.

You have a computer named Computer1 that runs Windows 10.

From Computer1, you plan to run a script that executes Windows PowerShell commands on the finance department computers.

You need to ensure that you can run the PowerShell commands on the finance department computers from Computer.

What should you do on the finance department computers?

choices.A: From Windows PowerShell, run the Enable-MMAgent cmdlet.
choices.B: From the local Group Policy, enable the Allow Remote Shell Access setting.
choices.D: From the local Group Policy, enable the Turn on Script Execution setting.
choices.C: From Windows PowerShell, run the Enable-PSRemoting cmdlet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/enable-psremoting?view=powershell-6

The most practical question is not there. With GPO.
Enable WinRM Service.
Windows Remote Management and Allow the connection
So then it is C

comments.content: You're right. No point in using local group policies considering they are using AD. The logical way to do this would be a GPO, but in absence of that I guess C is the best option.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is indeed C. Question is what should you do on the finance computers. D. says from local Group Policy You enable script execution. That means you will still have to do it for every Computer in finance. C is the most efficient way.

comments.content: The thing is that D says "local" group policy. Not a GPO.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Given answer is correct and here is my opinion.
The question is about 
- Active Directory
- more computers in a specific department (not a single computer)

What's the best solution?
(answer C) "Enable-PSRemoting cmdlet" on every single computer in Finance department 
or 
(answer D) "Group Policy, enable the Turn on Script Execution setting"?
I prefer to create a single policy for Finance department and the job it's done (effort minimized is recurring in Microsoft exams).

What do you think?

Selected Answer: C
C. From Windows PowerShell, run the Enable-PSRemoting cmdlet.

Here's why:

 Enable-PSRemoting is specifically designed to enable remote PowerShell access. This cmdlet configures the necessary settings on the target computers to allow remote PowerShell connections.
 The other options are not directly related to enabling remote PowerShell:
 Enable-MMAgent is used for managing mobile devices.
 The "Allow Remote Shell Access" group policy setting is primarily for enabling remote access for command prompt (cmd.exe), not PowerShell.
 The "Turn on Script Execution" group policy setting controls whether scripts can run locally on a computer, but it doesn't enable remote PowerShell access.

By running Enable-PSRemoting on the finance department computers, you'll ensure that they are ready to receive and execute PowerShell commands from Computer1.

ChatGPT: To run PowerShell commands on the finance department computers from Computer1, you should do C. From Windows PowerShell, run the Enable-PSRemoting cmdlet. This cmdlet enables PowerShell remoting, allowing you to execute commands on remote computers.

Selected Answer: C
C. From Windows PowerShell, run the Enable-PSRemoting cmdlet.

Ref: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/enable-psremoting?view=powershell-7.4#:~:text=The%20Enable%2DPSRemoting%20cmdlet%20performs%20the%20following%20operations%3A

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/enable-psremoting?view=powershell-6

comments.content: I wonder if it is ExamTopics moderators that mark answers or whichever 3rd party entities they receive the info from.

discussion.content:
D. an enrollment status page.

The enrollment status page allows you to display the progress of app and profile configurations during Autopilot provisioning. Additionally, you can configure the enrollment status page to block users from using the devices until all apps and profiles are installed, ensuring that the devices are fully configured before users can access them.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

The enrollment status page (ESP) displays the provisioning status to people enrolling Windows devices and signing in for the first time. You can configure the ESP to block device use until all required policies and applications are installed.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/windows-enrollment-status#:~:text=The%20enrollment%20status%20page%20(ESP)%20displays%20the%20provisioning%20status%20to%20people%20enrolling%20Windows%20devices%20and%20signing%20in%20for%20the%20first%20time.%20You%20can%20configure%20the%20ESP%20to%20block%20device%20use%20until%20all%20required%20policies%20and%20applications%20are%20installed.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that includes Microsoft Intune.

You plan to use Windows Autopilot to deploy Windows 11 devices.

You need to meet the following requirements during Autopilot provisioning:

• Display the app and profile configuration progress.
• Block users from using the devices until all apps and profiles are installed

What should you configure?

comments.content: Agreed - Device Health and Defender for endpoint, it tested in my tenant

discussion.content: Correct answer is Device Health and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. I checked in my own tenant.

comments.content: If you plan on memorizing the answers to all these questions you are going to have a bad time. Instead read the question, answer to the best of your ability and then review the discussions to get a consensus on the correct answers. If you do all that you might actually be worth something to an employer.

Device Health: 
The Health Attestation Service can be configured through the Device Health settings tree within the Compliance policy settings. Health Attestation includes reporting about Secure Boot enablement. 
Ref: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/operating-system-security/system-security/protect-high-value-assets-by-controlling-the-health-of-windows-10-based-devices#protect-control-and-report-on-the-security-status-of-windows-10-based-devices:~:text=The%20Health%20Attestation%20Service%20provides%20the,Secure%20Boot%20enablement

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription. The subscription contains 1,000 computers that run Windows 11 and are enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

You plan to create a compliance policy that has the following options enabled:

• Require Secure Boot to be enabled on the device.
• Require the device to be at or under the machine risk score.

Which two Compliance settings should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate settings in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The domain contains 25 computers that run Windows 11.

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription

You have an Azure AD tenant that syncs with contoso.com.

You configure hybrid Azure AD join and discover that some of the computers have a registered state of Pending.

You need to ensure that the computers complete the join successfully.

What should you ensure?

choices.B: that the users of the computers are assigned Microsoft 365 licenses
choices.C: that each computer has a line of sight to a domain controller
choices.D: that the computers contain the latest quality updates
choices.A: that Windows is activated on all the computers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. that each computer has a line of sight to a domain controller

Back to the basics with this one. No DC = No bueno

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Microsoft Entra hybrid joined devices require network line of sight to your domain controllers periodically. Without this connection, devices become unusable.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/devices/hybrid-join-plan#:~:text=Microsoft%20Entra%20hybrid%20joined%20devices%20require%20network%20line%20of%20sight%20to%20your%20domain%20controllers%20periodically.%20Without%20this%20connection%2C%20devices%20become%20unusable.
Given answer is correct
Correct

correct answer: C

Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/devices/hybrid-join-plan

Selected Answer: C
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/devices/hybrid-join-plan#prerequisites

comments.content: for hybrid azure ad join you do not need any licenses, this is just the sync from on-premise to Azure AD. Requirement is line of sight with domain controller for the state to switch to registered and then there can be activity
The Microsoft 365 subscription will help with that.

discussion.content: I am not sure, but "b" is the right answer. Licensing.

Selected Answer: E
E. Device1, Device2, Device3, and Device4

Selected Answer: A
Based on the types of devices listed and their compatibility with Intune for update management, the correct answer is:

A. Device1 only

Here's why:

Windows devices (Device1) can have updates managed through Intune.

Intune supports managing updates on Windows devices, but does not currently support managing OS updates for Android, iOS, or macOS devices (Device2, Device3, and Device4).

However, Intune can manage other configurations and policies for Android, iOS, and macOS devices, but not OS updates specifically.
